summary: Internal email discussing a FOIA request from the New York Times to the Bureau of Prisons regarding Jeffrey Epstein documents. The Civil Division notes that some responsive documents reference Tartaglione, and the team prosecuting MCC guards is withholding those pages to avoid interfering with their prosecution. The email is for informational purposes to keep recipients aware of the situation.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: Referenced in BOP documents responsive to a NYT FOIA request about Epstein; the prosecution team for MCC guards is withholding pages mentioning him to avoid interference with their case.

events.title: FOIA Request Handling Discussion
events.description: Internal email discusses handling of a FOIA request from the New York Times to BOP regarding Epstein documents, noting that documents referencing Tartaglione are being withheld to prevent interference with the prosecution of MCC guards.

keyFacts: The New York Times submitted a FOIA request to the Bureau of Prisons for documents relating to Jeffrey Epstein.
Some responsive BOP documents reference an individual named Tartaglione.
The prosecution team handling the case against MCC guards has decided to withhold all pages mentioning Tartaglione to avoid interfering with their prosecution.
The email suggests that if the MCC guards case concludes before Tartaglione's trial finishes, they may need to reassess whether to continue withholding those documents.
This correspondence highlights internal DOJ considerations about document disclosure in overlapping legal cases involving Epstein-related matters.
